In the great Battle of the Compacts, which one would be the clear winner? Which would be the better purchase without the dreadful ‘Buyers Remorse’? Let the deconstructing begin!

First let’s stack the key specs against each other and see how they hold up.

Canon G7X vs. Sony RX100: A Quick Comparison

Who Are These Cameras Best Suited For?

Canon PowerShot G7X Mark III

  • Vloggers & Content Creators: The flip-up touchscreen, microphone jack, and 
  • Good low-light performance makes it a solid choice.
  • Travelers & Casual Photographers: Lightweight, compact, and easy to use.
  • Beginner Videographers: Simple controls, good 4K video, and decent stabilization.

Sony RX100 VII

  • Serious Photographers & Hybrid Shooters: Advanced autofocus, longer zoom (24-200mm), and high-speed shooting make it great for action and travel.
  • Filmmakers & Professional Videographers: Features like super slow motion (960fps) and blackout-free 20fps shooting give it an edge.
  • Street & Event Photographers: The pop-up EVF and superior autofocus make it better for fast-moving subjects.

Where do they fall short? 

Canon PowerShot G7X Mark III 

  • No Viewfinder – Relies on the LCD screen, which can be hard to see in bright sunlight.
  • Limited Autofocus – Contrast-detect AF isn’t as fast or accurate as Sony’s hybrid AF.
  • Short Zoom Range – 4.2x optical zoom (100mm max) is limiting compared to the RX100 VII.
  • Battery Life – Shorter than Sony’s, requiring extra batteries for extended use.

Sony RX100 VII 

  • Expensive – Costs nearly double the price of the G7X Mark III.
  • Slower Lens – Starts at f/2.8 instead of f/1.8, which affects low-light performance.
  • Complex Menu System – More settings and customization, but harder for beginners.
  • Touchscreen Limitations – Limited touch functions; you can’t navigate the menu via touch.

Best Accessories for Beginner Canon G7X Mark III & Sony RX100 VII users

1. Memory Cards 

  • SanDisk Extreme Pro 128GB UHS-I U3 – Fast write speeds for 4K video and burst shooting.
  • Lexar Professional 1667x 128GB UHS-II – Higher read speeds for quicker file transfers.
  • Canon NB-13L Battery Pack – Official battery for G7X Mark III.
  • Sony NP-BX1 Battery Pack – Official battery for RX100 VII.
  • Wasabi Power Battery Pack (2-Pack + Charger) – Budget-friendly alternative for both cameras.
    Wasabi Power for Canon
    Wasabi Power for Sony

3. Tripods & Stabilizers

  • JOBY GorillaPod 3K – Flexible tripod for vlogging and handheld shooting.
  • Manfrotto PIXI Mini Tripod – Compact and great for travel.
  • DJI Osmo Mobile 6 – If shooting video with your phone, this gimbal stabilizes footage.

4. Microphones 

  • RØDE VideoMicro Compact Mic – Great for vlogging and travel (requires a 3.5mm mic adapter for the RX100 VII).
  • Sony ECM-G1 Shotgun Mic – Compact and optimized for Sony cameras.
  • DJI Mic Wireless Kit – Ideal for interviews and professional audio.

5. Lighting 

  • Lume Cube 2.0 LED Light – Compact and bright for vlogging or night photography.
  • Neewer LED Panel Light – Adjustable brightness for indoor shooting.

6. ND Filters 

  • Gobe ND Filter Kit (3-Pack, 52mm) – Helps control exposure in bright conditions.
  • Tiffen Variable ND Filter (52mm) – Great for adjusting exposure dynamically.

7. Camera Cases & Protection

  • Canon PSC-4200 Case – Official case for G7X Mark III.
  • Sony LCJ-RXK Jacket Case – Official case for RX100 series.
  • Megagear Leather Camera Case – Stylish and protective for both models.
    For Canon
    For Sony

 8. Screen Protectors

  • Expert Shield Glass Protector – Prevents scratches and smudges on the touchscreen.
    Expert Shield for Canon
    Expert Shield for Sony
  • PCTC Anti-Glare Screen Protector – Helps visibility in bright light.

9. Grip Extensions & Wireless Control

  • Sony VCT-SGR1 Shooting Grip – Doubles as a mini tripod and remote control for RX100 VII.
  • Canon HG-100TBR Tripod Grip – Ideal for handheld shooting with G7X Mark III.

Best Setup for Beginner Canon PowerShot Mark III & Sony RX100 VII Photographers and Videographers

Best Vlogging Setup 

Both models make a great choice for vloggers who need smooth footage, good audio, and portability but how do they stack up against each other?

Canon PowerShot G7X Mark III Vlogging Kit

  • Memory Card – SanDisk Extreme Pro 128GB UHS-I U3
  • Tripod Grip – Canon HG-100TBR (Doubles as a tripod & Bluetooth remote)
  • Microphone – RØDE VideoMicro Compact Mic (For better audio)
  • Lighting – Lume Cube 2.0 LED (For better face lighting in low light)
  • Extra Batteries – Canon NB-13L (Or Wasabi Power alternatives)

Sony RX100 VII Vlogging Kit

  • Memory Card – Lexar Professional 1667x 128GB UHS-II
  • Tripod Grip – Sony VCT-SGR1 Shooting Grip (Doubles as a tripod & remote)
  • Microphone – Sony ECM-G1 Shotgun Mic (Compact, designed for Sony cameras)
  • Lighting – Neewer LED Panel Light (For bright, even lighting)
  • Extra Batteries – Sony NP-BX1 (Or Wasabi Power alternatives)

Verdict

The Canon G7X III has a flip-up screen, built-in stabilization, and bright f/1.8 lens for low-light shots while the Sony RX100 VII has superior autofocus, a longer zoom (24-200mm), and a pop-up viewfinder for better framing.

Best Travel Photography Setup

For travelers who want a compact, lightweight kit for capturing landscapes, portraits, and action shots. Which would make a better companion?

  • Camera Case – Megagear Leather Case (Protects from dust & scratches)
  • Memory Card – SanDisk Extreme Pro 256GB (More storage for long trips)
  • Tripod – JOBY GorillaPod 3K (Flexible tripod for uneven surfaces)
  • Extra Batteries – 2-3 spare batteries (For long shooting days)
  • ND Filters – Tiffen Variable ND Filter (52mm) (For controlling exposure in bright conditions)

Verdict

Canon G7X III is better for low-light shots and street photography due to its f/1.8 lens.

Sony RX100 VII is better for wildlife and landscapes because of its 200mm zoom & fast autofocus.

Best Video Setup 

For filmmakers who need stable, high-quality footage with great audio.

Which one would make the better kit?

  • Gimbal Stabilizer – DJI Ronin SC (For buttery-smooth handheld shots)
  • Microphone – DJI Mic Wireless Kit (For crisp, wireless audio)
  • Lighting – Godox SL60W LED Light (Soft, continuous lighting)
  • ND Filter – Gobe ND Filter Kit (For cinematic motion blur)
  • Tripod – Manfrotto Befree Advanced (Lightweight but sturdy)

Verdict

Sony RX100 VII is the better option here due to its super slow-motion (960fps), better autofocus, and EVF for professional framing.

Best Budget Setup 

For those who want great accessories without spending too much. Which one would hurt the pocket less?

  • Memory Card – SanDisk Ultra 128GB (Affordable but fast enough for 4K video)
  • Tripod – Manfrotto PIXI Mini Tripod (Simple, compact, and budget-friendly)
  • Microphone – Moukey MCM-1 Shotgun Mic (Cheaper alternative to RØDE mics)
  • Extra Batteries – Wasabi Power 2-Pack + Charger (More affordable than official batteries)
  • Screen Protector – PCTC Anti-Glare Screen Protector (Prevents scratches & improves visibility)

Verdict

Canon G7X III is the better budget-friendly choice, as it’s already cheaper than the Sony RX100 VII and still offers great quality.

FAQs

1. Which camera is better for vlogging?

Canon G7X Mark III has a brighter lens (f/1.8), flip-up touchscreen, and easier-to-use interface but the Sony RX100 VII has better autofocus and zoom, making it more suited for the job.

2. Which one has better autofocus?

Sony RX100 VII wins hands down with its 357-point phase-detect and 425 contrast-detect AF system. It’s significantly faster and a whole lot better at tracking moving subjects than the Canon G7X Mark III’s contrast-detect AF.

3. Is the Canon G7X Mark III good for low light?

Absolutely, the Canon G7X Mark III performs well in low light due to its f/1.8 aperture at 24mm. However, the Sony RX100 VII has a slower f/2.8 aperture, which may struggle in darker settings.

4. Which one has a better zoom?

Sony RX100 VII has a much better zoom range (24-200mm vs. Canon’s 24-100mm). If you need more reach, go with Sony.

5. Which one is better for travel?

If you want a simple, lightweight, and budget-friendly travel camera, the Canon G7X Mark III is a great option but if what you need is long zoom, fast autofocus, and pro-level features, then Sony RX100 VII is a wiser choice.

6. Which one has better video features?

Well, both cameras shoot 4K at 30fps and 1080p at 120fps, but the Sony RX100 VII has 960fps super slow-motion, better autofocus, and a pop-up viewfinder, making it a better choice for advanced videographers.
